<title level="1" right="Rules">[Varying Statistics](/Rules.aspx?ID=3222)</title>

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 282 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Each type of wand has a level and Price determined by the spell's rank. The wand's rarity matches the spell's rarity, and it has its spell's traits. A wand has the normal Hardness, BT, and HP of a thin item of its material (see [Materials](/Rules.aspx?ID=3188)).

The traits for a wand vary based on the spell it contains. A wand always has the [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=644) and [wand](/Traits.aspx?ID=731) traits, plus any traits that might be relevant to identifying the item, such as [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=629) or [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604). The GM determines the extra traits.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
